Class TextureMap_

  • java.lang.Object
    • TextureMap_
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

    public class TextureMap_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
    ImageJ plugin to calculate a variance or signal-to-noise map of a digital x-ray image.

    The routine will run on a user-selected rectangular region of interest (ROI). If no ROI is selected then the whole image is selected and analysed.

    It breaks the large ROI into smaller square ROIs, and calculates the chosen statistical parameter for each region. The user is asked to supply the side-length of the smaller ROIs (in mm).

    The routine calculates variance as:

    sum[x - mean(x)] / n

    The routine calculates standard deviation as:

    sqrt(variance)

    The routine calculates signal-to-noise as:

    mean(x) / standard deviation(x)

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public int setup(java.lang.String arg,
                 ij.ImagePlus imp)
        Setup method that is automatically called if the plugin is triggered from an ImageJ menu.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
        Parameters:
        arg - Used if calling the plugin from another command to set the texture type. Options are variance, snr and standard_dev. If arg is empty then the user is presented with a dialogue box to choose the required processing type.
        imp - The ImagePlus of the currently selected image. This is automatically passed to the plugin by ImageJ.
        Returns:
        A value informing ImageJ what type of images this plugin can handle. Set to DOES_ALL

      • run

        public void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Method that is automatically called after the setup method when the plugin is triggered from an ImageJ menu. The user is prompted for a sub-sample size (mm). The routine then calculates the chosen statistic in a square ROI of the supplied size positioned in the top left hand corner of the image. The calculated value is used as the pixel value of the corresponding position in a results image. The ROI is then moved in a raster fashion over the whole image, generating the statistic for each location and assigning this value to the corresponding location in the results image. The results image values are scaled to enhance contrast and displayed on the screen.
        Specified by:
        run in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
        Parameters:
        ip - The ImageProcessor of the currently selected image. This is automatically passed to the plugin by ImageJ.
